trigger_event: Public outrage explodes after proof of a rigged BCI vote, plunging Stenograd into chaos as citizens demand answers and accountability. Nikola, one of few with access to hidden Council records and critical system controls, is pressured from all sides to act.
dilemma: Nikola must choose between unlocking the BCI's secret confessional logs to give Stenograd the truth—risking mass retribution and division—or activating Halden’s secret failsafe, plunging the city into a randomized cycle of privilege and restriction, forcing all residents to experience life as both the powerful and the powerless.
reason: Nikola is torn by his duty to expose corruption and restore trust, versus his fear that unleashing old wounds will tear the city apart. His unique access and deep knowledge make him the pivot point, but his conscience and conversations with Alex keep him undecided.
choice_a: Authorize the BCI to release all confessions and hidden Council orders to the city, exposing past abuses and secrets to the public.
belief_a: Truth is the foundation for real healing, no matter how painful.
Secrets breed mistrust and cycles of abuse.
Justice requires confronting the past openly.
choice_b: Trigger Halden’s failsafe: scramble all privileges and restrictions at random for everyone, letting each person feel both power and powerlessness, hiding the truth to force empathy instead of revenge.
belief_b: Experience—not blame—gives rise to real understanding.
Truth without mercy breeds endless vengeance.
Order can be restored by giving people perspective, not paperwork.
